title: Why do LOL players want to fight so bad?
body:
Take a look at my last game. I played Miss Fortune and my score was 11/0/4. I rocked that game; however, for whatever reason, my support complained at me the entire game. Every team fight was followed with: "MF I hate you. You just stand there and do nothing. You're useless." Um... I was attacking. How am I useless...? This teammate also used all chat to express what garbage I was. I think the term "ball sucker" was used too.

I never retaliated or insulted or even cursed at this teammate. Not once. I said, "I think I'm doing well... But if harassing me makes you feel better? Go for it." This was followed with "Um. I'm sick of dying because you won't attack." But... I was attacking. I used everything. Hell, I obviously got kills.

None of my teammates expressed their distaste for my support's words. No one stood up for me. I'm an adult and I don't need anyone to help me when I'm getting bullied; HOWEVER, the fact that no one said anything while I was getting harassed is pretty sad. Actually, the fact that this person was harassing me IN THE FIRST PLACE is absolutely atrocious.

Call me wrong, but I make an effort to stand up for people getting harassed in league, even if they were playing crappy. There is no excuse for calling people garbage, especially in a GAME!

Why...? Just why? Tell me... Why do LOL players want to fight so much? Why can't we just have fun?

This is why people leave this game. Because of nonsense like this.

I don't particularly agree with the fact you SHOULDN'T flame(even though in most cases it's bad to) but I do agree that even if you have to get aggressive to get your point across you should flame people to get them to understand.

Example:

You have a Garen on your team and you're vs all ad champs. Instead of building armor be starts stacking magic resist. If you politely tell him to build armor and he ignores you then you start getting a tad aggressive to show him you weren't only fooling. Then he continues to ignore you and call you names that's when you need to get aggressive and tell him what he's doing wrong. 

(Yes I Know a bad example since nobody is that stupid but yea) 

If someone is doing bad through obvious mistakes I don't think you should reward them and make them think it's ok to make those mistakes that way they'll just keep making them and not try to improve but rather punish them (no matter how light or heavy it is) to be sure they don't make it again. 


For those who don't know this is the common method the military uses to train better soldiers. 

1 second late for formation? Punished. Now you have to be there 15 seconds early (after push-ups ofc) 
Still 1 second late? Punished. Now you get there 30 seconds early. 

Same goes for league. You don't have to be a total assbag and tell someone to kill themselves but you don't need to be so passive that you allow someone to make obvious mistakes and keep making them. They won't improve

Anonymity is a powerful tool that the internet has armed its communities with. People live their days in the outside world by their normal names, and they stress over things both significant and not so. But on the web, they can live by any name other than their own, and they can live by any code that they want.

Stress gives people the motivation for flaming and bullying: stress over how their day went outside the game, stress over how poorly they are actually performing in the game. Anonymity over the web gives people the tools to bully and flame others without retaliation or repercussion.

Sadly, I do not know of any way to deal with these individuals. But remember, even if they are saying nasty things, none of what they say will matter in ~30-45 minutes since after the game, each of you will go your separate ways. And if they become absolutely unbearable, remember the most powerful tool that Riot offers you to help ignore them: the Mute Button.

Keep shining the light of hope and reason, fellow summoner
This is why I like playing support more. If your adc is a douche bag you can just leave bot lane forever, but if you are an adc you don't get that option.
